pageContext.claim: “A lot of badly run companies are trying to blame tariffs. In other words, if they're running badly and they're having a bad quarter, or if they're just unlucky in some way, they're likely to blame the tariffs. It's not the tariffs. It's called bad management. So a lot of companies are coming out and they're not affected by the tariffs.”
pageContext.analysis: Most economists blame Trump's trade war with China for slowing down U.S. economic growth, hurting the agricultural and manufacturing sectors especially and raising costs on U.S. consumers.
